Being injured didn't mean that Tucson was ready to give up.  But he knew he=
 had to take his time and not jump to conclusions.  Attacking whoever was c=
oming was not a good idea, but remaining alert was.  He tests the air with =
his nostrils and listens carefully as to what is approaching him.  He shift=
s his weight and gets onto his four feet in preparation to move if he had t=
o. Yet he wanted the approachers to know that he was no small creature.  He=
 rumbles a  deep draconic growl just to give the approachers an idea what t=
hey were coming close to.

Perpetually on the move and constantly busy. 

O=
n Sep 10, 2011, at 12:26 AM, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote=
:

> > <OLD>
> >
> > Tucson slowly backs away, remaining low to the ground.=
 He was not about to
> > give his position away just yet. But he wished he =
could get to the bottom
> > of what was going on. It disturbed him to think=
 he could have lost Rodimus
> > for the second time in a row. But for now h=
e had to hold his position.
> 
> <NEW>
> 
> Getting to the bottom of things=
, yes that would be what TUSCON or any
> leader would be looking to do. Max=
imals are missing in fact one of the
> leaders is missing, missing with a c=
omponant of the Matrix still
> beating in his chest. Where was he? Was he t=
ruely turned back into a
> dark version of himself or was this some clone?
=
> 
> Also Cheetor was still missing as well as well as Optimus Primal?
> Wh=
ere they also being held somewhere in this jungle or where they
> elsewhere=
 still waiting for TUSCON to find them? Had anyone even seen
> RHINOX in so=
me time? Where had they all gone?
> 
> Also, why were the Dinobots attackin=
g Maximals? These were once heros,
> ones that centuries ago TUSCON may hav=
e called friends! Yes the
> Dinobots had not been soon after the Decepticon=
s had surrendered to
> the Autobots more than three centuries ago, but what=
 could have
> happened to them since? Where they under the control of anoth=
er or
> just out of control?
> 
> So many questions and so few answers. Thi=
s was something would take
> time to unravel, if only TUSCON could conquer =
his own anger and
> impatience.
> 
> In the distance TUSCON could hear GRIM=
LOCK and his men in conflict
> with something, but mostly what he could hea=
r was their roars of anger
> and frustration. There might have been the sou=
nd of an engine revving
> or was it some sort of explosion? At this range i=
t was difficult to
> tell.
> 
> Then TUSCON could hear footsteps of somethi=
ng approaching, perhaps two
> or three individuals moving through the brush=
. Where they friend or
> enemy? With no IFF signatures there was no way to =
know. But they were
> moving in TUSCON's direction.
> 
> (TAG)
> 
> Preston=

      <p>> <OLD><br>
><br>
> Tucson slowly backs away=
, remaining low to the ground.  He was not about to<br>
> give his posit=
ion away just yet.  But he wished he could get to the bottom<br>
> of wh=
at was going on.  It disturbed him to think he could have lost Rodimus<br>
=
> for the second time in a row.  But for now he had to hold his position=
.<br>
<br>
<NEW><br>
<br>
Getting to the bottom of things, yes that w=
ould be what TUSCON or any<br>
leader would be looking to do. Maximals are =
missing in fact one of the<br>
leaders is missing, missing with a componant=
 of the Matrix still<br>
beating in his chest. Where was he? Was he truely =
turned back into a<br>
dark version of himself or was this some clone?<br>
=
<br>
Also Cheetor was still missing as well as well as Optimus Primal?<br>
=
Where they also being held somewhere in this jungle or where they<br>
elsew=
here still waiting for TUSCON to find them? Had anyone even seen<br>
RHINOX=
 in some time? Where had they all gone?<br>
<br>
Also, why were the Dinobot=
s attacking Maximals? These were once heros,<br>
ones that centuries ago TU=
SCON may have called friends! Yes the<br>
Dinobots had not been soon after =
the Decepticons had surrendered to<br>
the Autobots more than three centuri=
es ago, but what could have<br>
happened to them since? Where they under th=
e control of another or<br>
just out of control?<br>
<br>
So many questions=
 and so few answers. This was something would take<br>
time to unravel, if =
only TUSCON could conquer his own anger and<br>
impatience.<br>
<br>
In the=
 distance TUSCON could hear GRIMLOCK and his men in conflict<br>
with somet=
hing, but mostly what he could hear was their roars of anger<br>
and frustr=
ation. There might have been the sound of an engine revving<br>
or was it s=
ome sort of explosion? At this range it was difficult to<br>
tell.<br>
<br>=

Then TUSCON could hear footsteps of something approaching, perhaps two<br>=

or three individuals moving through the brush. Where they friend or<br>
en=
emy? With no IFF signatures there was no way to know. But they were<br>
mov=
ing in TUSCON's direction.<br>
<br>
(TAG)<br>
<br>
Preston<br>
